alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:36PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Osceola County through 315 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Kissimmee, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Kenansville and Forever Florida. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
